title: Climb to Karkotak from Bhimtal
review: If you relish a mountain climb full of thrill and adventure and wish to do an off beat trek then Karkotak in Bhimtal is the best bet. Perched atop the highest mountain in Bhimtal is Karkotaka which has a ancient temple devoted to Naga devta.  A fair(mela) is held atop Karkotaka Temple on Nag Panchmi. I climbed towards the Karkotaka temple from the Bhimtal -Naukuchiatal road a little before the diversion to Jangaliagaon.  The climb is tough and arduous through winding tracks which gradually take you upwards.   The path is mostly barren but as you reach the top just before the final climb there is patch of green trees and if your throat is parched you can gulp mouthful of water from an ancient water source.   This patch of green is clearly visible if you look at the Karkotaka temple from the Bhimtal-Haldwani road.  My uncle who used to live in Bhimtal told me that there is a folklore about a subterranean lake inside the mountain.  Once you make the final climb to Karkotaka from the green patch you would find that the ancient temple is an assemblage of rounded rocks. The view from atop is incomparable and majestic as offers a 360 degree view of all the places around.  It took me nearly four hours to climb up and down the mountain.

title: Nag Temple
review: The temple is named after snake cobra and at the height of 600 ft at the Karkotaka  hills. visited and worshiped by thousands of people over the year. Excellent trakking place and beautiful surroundings.

title: Amazing Trek
review: I visited this temple alongwith my girlfriend. The trek was very good. It is on top of a hill, which is the highest point in Bhimtal. Amazing experience. :-)

title: Hiking Trip to Karkotak Temple
review: We visited Karkotak Temple (Temple of the Snake God and said to be the younger brother of Sheshnag). The temple is atop a hill (the highest in Bhimtal nearly 6000 Ft). It was a steady climb (doable for all as we had a 12 year kid with us who infact did excellent) of nearly 3 KMs from a point on Bhimtal Naukuchiyatal Road (took two hours for us as we were on a hiking trip and were carrying our backpacks). All along the hike you get views of Bhimtal. Once you are  at the top you get almost 360 degree views (do not expect a lot as you are only at 6000 Ft). It is a good place for camping as well which we did. The next morning we visited the Temple and paid our respects. I was told that they even have a room which they can open for guests who wants to stay there for the night. The Temple also has electricity point which one may use for charging cell phones etc. Overall a good visit.

title: Nice temple
review: Nice temple in bhimtal, but it was too high. No taxi would go there you can go with on your own feet. But after reach there it was awsome. from there the view of bhimtal was soooo nice.

title: Auspicious
review: A must visit place in bhimtal dedicated to nag devta. Offers a glimpse of bhimtal, naukuchiatal, sattal and also the great HIMALAYAS. Also has an ancient temple dedicated to Hanuman nearby

title: Worth the trek
review: a small temple, but at a beautiful picturesque location. Need to trek to reach the place.  But once you reach there, you will never regret your decision for hard trek.

title: Amazing Spritual Place
review: Good place to go to for trekking. Nice all round view of whole of Bhimtal and also Haldwani is visible from the top. It is situated on top of a hill and one has to go via trekking.

title: Good for trekking
review: Isolated from the crowd, quiet location, serene view of the Bhimtal lake & town.
